About.title: About Me
About.content: I am Eric Lucero González, a PhD student specializing in Artificial Intelligence. This blog serves as a platform to share my research, insights, and developments in the field of AI. metadata.title: Tech Stack & Architecture | Eric Lucero
metadata.description: Explore the self-made architecture behind this research blog: Next.js, Vercel, React, MDX, and LaTeX integration for scientific communication.
metadata.keywords: Next.js, Vercel, React, MDX, LaTeX, Web Architecture, Open Source, Tech Stack, Web Development, Chart.js

About.stack_Next: The project's core. I use Next.js deployed on **Vercel**, allowing me to go beyond traditional static site limitations. I leverage hybrid rendering (Server Components + Static Generation) and their Edge Network to deliver an instant, secure, and globally scalable website.
About.stack_React: The interface library. It allows me to think of the web as reusable LEGO pieces (components). From the navigation bar to the post cards, everything is a modular component managing its own state and logic.
About.stack_javascript: The language connecting everything. I use it for both interface logic and interactive simulations (like genetic algorithms) that run directly in your browser.
About.stack_styled: CSS on steroids. It allows me to write real CSS styles inside my JavaScript components. It is the key tool managing the theme system (Dark/Light mode) and ensures that one component's styles do not break another's.
About.stack_i18n: The internationalization layer. It manages dynamic routing (/es, /en) and optimized JSON dictionary loading compatible with Server Components. It enables this blog to be natively bilingual without sacrificing static performance.
About.stack_fontawesome: Provides the site's vector iconography (social media, UI indicators). Being SVGs, they look crisp at any resolution and screen size without affecting performance.
About.stack_MDX: Much more than plain text. MDX allows me to write articles in standard Markdown while embedding interactive React components (charts, simulators) directly between paragraphs. This is what makes this blog 'alive' and not just static text.
About.stack_remark: The brain behind the text. It is the processor that reads my Markdown files and builds an 'Abstract Syntax Tree' (AST). Basically, it understands the structure of my notes and transforms them into secure HTML.
About.stack_latex: The gold standard in academic writing. Thanks to the integration with Remark, I can write complex equations and scientific notation (like $\Sigma$) directly in Markdown. The system renders them as perfect mathematical vectors, essential for explaining papers and algorithms.
About.stack_chartjs: The visualization engine. It renders interactive and responsive data graphics via HTML5 Canvas. I use it to plot the convergence of genetic algorithms and statistical results in real-time.
About.stack_github: The code repository. It serves as the project's 'source of truth' for version control. Hosting the code here ensures transparency and allows the community to audit, fork, or learn from the source, aligning with Open Science principles.
About.stack_vercel: The infrastructure platform. It connects directly to GitHub to build and deploy the site. It provides the Global Edge Network required for high-performance content delivery and supports the dynamic server-side features of Next.js.

sections.intro: This website is a personal and academic portfolio with no direct commercial purpose. My philosophy regarding your privacy is simple: I do not collect unnecessary personal information, I do not track you across the Internet, and I do not sell your data. Below is the legal information required by Spanish and European regulations.

owner.title: 1. Site Owner
owner.content: The owner of this website is **Eric Lucero González** (hereinafter, 'the Owner'). You can contact me regarding this site at: **ericlucerogonzalez@gmail.com**.

data.title: 2. Data Protection (GDPR)
data.content: This website **does not collect personal data** from its visitors. There are no registration forms, comments, or analytics trackers (like Google Analytics). Your browsing is completely anonymous.

copyright.title: 3. Copyright & Licensing

As a researcher, articles may reflect partial states of knowledge or ongoing experiments.

hosting.title: 5. Hosting & Third Parties
hosting.content: For technical operation, this site uses third-party services that process necessary technical data (logs, IP addresses) to serve content:
hosting.vercel: **Vercel:** Hosting and Deployment. This website is served via the global infrastructure of Vercel Inc. (USA). Vercel processes browser requests and logs IP addresses strictly for technical purposes (security, DDoS protection, and performance).
hosting.github: **GitHub:** Code Repository. The source code of this project is Open Source and hosted on GitHub Inc. (Microsoft) servers. While it does not serve the website directly to users, it acts as the source of truth for continuous deployment.
hosting.cloudinary: **Cloudinary:** Media Optimization. Images and videos are served through the Cloudinary Ltd. CDN, processing traffic data to optimize visual delivery.
hosting.base_legal: The processing of this technical data is based on Legitimate Interest (Art. 6.1.f GDPR) to guarantee network security and the correct technical delivery of the requested content.
